alert.note: Alert for St. Charles (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 9:00PM CDT until May 12 at 9:24PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri...Illinois... Mississippi River at Louisiana. Mississippi River at Mel Price LD. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri...Illinois... Mississippi River at Winfield. Mississippi River at Clarksville. Mississippi River at Grafton. Mississippi River at Chester. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Mel Price LD. * WHEN...Until late Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Highway 94 and the east end of Harbor Point Road off of Highway 94 north of West Alton begin flooding within a foot or so of this height. Also, the access road to the Lincoln Shields area off Highway 67 just west of the Clark bridge begins flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 20.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 25.0 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg 7 pm Fri Sat Sun Mon Tue Mississippi River Mel Price LD 21.0 20.7 23.1 24.9 24.6 23.6 22.5 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Rainfall heavier than forecast could cause river levels to rise even higher than predicted. The National Weather Service will monitor this developing situation and issue follow up statements as conditions change. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
